thread.title: Joey Barton defends himself on social media
thread.title_full: Joey Barton defends himself on social media | Daily Mail Online

author: Joe Bernstein for MailOnline
title: Joey Barton defends himself on social media
text:
Joey Barton was forced to defend himself against accusations of cheating after his running battle with Lincoln’s Matt Rhead turned ugly during Burnley’s shock FA Cup fifth round defeat against the non-leaguers at Turf Moor.
Barton trod on Rhead’s foot midway through the second half and then fell over claiming his opponent had caught him in the face even though no contact appeared to have been made, and was later booked following an incident in which Terry Hawkridge was shoved to the floor.
Rhead, a battering ram of a player who used to work as an engineer in a JCB factory, said afterwards: ‘Joey is obviously a great player. We had a little bit of a battle and he tried to upset a few.
Joey Barton goes down holding his face during Burnley's FA Cup clash with Lincoln
Lincoln striker Matt Rhead reacts to having his feet trodden on by Barton before a corner
Lincoln winger Terry Hawkridge reacts after appearing to be clawed by Barton
Asked if Barton had deliberately tried to get him in trouble with referee Graham Scott, Rhead said: ‘Possibly, I am not sure what he was thinking. I have gone to the ref and he has walked into my arm. He’d trod on my foot but that is part and parcel of the game. He just backed in but anyone who wants a bit of a fight, I’m up for it. ‘
Once Barton was aware at how television pictures perceived his apparent play-acting, he took to social media to put his side forward.
‘Wasn’t trying to get the big man sent off. It was my job to front screen and disrupt him. Was trying to get back in front of him,’ he tweeted.
‘Tried to duck under his arm and he moved it back and hit me on the head.’
As they wait for the ball to come into the box, Barton and Rhead jostle for position
Rhead waves in the direction of the referee after having his feed stood on by Barton
Barton cuts back inside Rhead, who is looking the other way, and walks into his arm
Barton goes to ground holding his head as Rhead tries to make his point to the official
Barton later took to social media to defend himself amid a storm of criticism
One Quote: : 'To be fair it was utterly embarrassing mate. Holding your head like you'd been pole-axed. This tweet just makes u look worse.'
Quote: : 'Then why were you on the floor holding your head as though he had tried to knock it off, be honest you were cheating.
Barton's uncomfortable afternoon ended in defeat, with Sean Raggett scoring an 89th-minute winner for the non-League Imps.
Barton was booked for an incident after his 'run-in' with Rhead, in which he appeared to claw the face of Lincoln winger Terry Hawkridge. He did not make comment on that.
Goalscorer Sean Raggett quipped: ‘I think Joey Barton would be more worried in a physical scenario. But Joey is a class player and I think we did really well against him.’
Burnley and Barton were on the wrong end of an FA Cup humbling at the hands of Lincoln
Rhead, 32, is set to be a major cult figure from now onwards.
‘We have come through a lot of battles to get here,’ he said. ‘It was just chaos in the dressing-room aftewards, pandemonium.
‘It is a great day and I don’t see why we can’t keep the momentum going. We find a way. At the start of the season, I told we should go and win the FA Cup. Now there is a little bit of belief anything can happen.
‘When Sean’s header went in, we were staring at the linesman, please get that flag up.
‘It is frightening what this team can achieve. A few lads have mentioned Leicester City winning the Premier League last season, we are going on the back of that.’
